data.title: Famous people from Savannah, GA
data.meta_description: Since its early days, the city of Savannah GA has given rise to many prominent citizens who were proud to call the city their home.
data.text:
The historic city of Savannah is one of the most prized residential communities in Georgia; thanks to its strategic location near the Atlantic coast. It is one of those cities which you visit for one week and all you can think about thereafter is starting a life there. Since its early days, the city has given rise to many prominent citizens who were proud to call the city their home.

Below is a list of famous people who have had the pleasure of living in Savannah, Georgia:

Antwan André Patton

Patton, known by the stage name Big Boi, is an award-winning rapper, record producer, and actor who was born and raised in Savannah, Georgia. Apart from enjoying a successful solo music career, Patton has also achieved a lot as a member of the Outkast hip-hop duo alongside André 3000. As an actor, he has starred in several top-rated films including Wild ‘n Out, Law & Order: Special Victims Unit, and the recently released horror movie-the Creepshow.

Hollis Stacy

Seasoned golfer Hollis Stacy is another famous native of savannah city. After achieving a lot of success in the minor golfing championships, Stacy became a member of the LPGA Tour in the early 70s and went on to win 18 events in her 24 years in the LPGA Tour. She also managed to bag four major championships including three U.S. Women’s Open tournaments, earning herself a spot in the World Golf Hall of Fame. Currently, Stacy resides in Denver, Colorado.

Russell Earl Dent

Dent, also known as Bucky Dent, is a retired MLB player and manager who is remembered as one of the greatest shortstops to ever play for the New York Yankees. After winning two World Series with the Yankees, Dent became the 1978 World Series MVP. He also played for the Chicago White Sox, Texas Rangers, and the Kansas City Royals. After retiring as a player, Dent took a coaching job in the minor league with the Columbus Clippers before managing the New York Yankee for two years. He currently resides in Lake Worth, Florida.

Desmond Harrington

Also born in born in the city of Savannah is Desmond Harrington, a sensational actor who featured in several notable films during the turn of the 21st century. Some of his most popular works include The Hole, the Wrong Turn, Ghost Ship, Gossip Girl, and Dexter. Currently, he is a resident of Los Angeles, California.

Other famous residents and former residents of Savannah include Bruce Feiler, Lloyd Blaine Hammond Jr., Robert Durden Inglis Sr., John C. Frémont, and Dianna Elise Agron just to mention a few.
